metricapp.utility

Class JacksonMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • metricapp.utility.JacksonMapper

  • @Service(value="JacksonMapper")
public class JacksonMapper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a utility, wired with Spring, that offers a lightweight converter for object to json string, and viceversa According to Jackson Documentation max performance of massive multithread use of mapper could be reached only with the separated use of writer and reader.

    Jackson Documentation permits to use mapper with a single instance, it is ThreadSafe: from Jackson Doc... "ObjectReader/ObjectWriter: these are light-weight immutable objects that can be safely shared between threads (and thus reused) as well"

    Example of use: jacksonMapper.toJson(myDTO) = return String of Json

      • toJson

        public java.lang.String toJson(java.lang.Object object)
                        throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        this method is a simple wrapper of writeValueAsString of writer.

        Example of use: jacksonMapper.toJson(myDTO) = return String of Json

        Parameters:
        object - that you want to convert
        Returns:
        String json formatted
        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

      • getReader

        public <T> com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectReader getReader(java.lang.Class<T> myClass)
        this method return a ready to operate reader, it is customized for class. It's easier to use function fromJson
        Parameters:
        myClass -
        Returns:
        a Reader Object

      • fromJson

        public <T> T fromJson(java.lang.String json,
                      java.lang.Class<T> myClass)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Easier function to convert a string json to object
        Parameters:
        json - String of json
        myClass - this is the class of destination of the mapping
        Returns:
        no cast needed, we do it for you.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the conversion failed
